'''Sewaddle''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''クルミル''' ''Kurumiru'') is a {{2t|Bug|Grass}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] into {{p|Swadloon}} starting at [[level]] 20, which evolves into {{p|Leavanny}} when [[level]]ed up with high [[friendship]].

==Biology==
[[File:Ash Sewaddle Rolled Up.png|thumb|left|250px|Sewaddle sleeping by covering its head with its hood]]
Sewaddle is a caterpillar-like Pokémon with a broad, bitten leaf enfolding its head like a hood. Its large, spherical head is an orange-yellow with two small, close-together knobs on its forehead. Sewaddle's eyes are black and circular, and its mouth has a downward-pointing, crescent-shaped orange snout with a sharp tiny tooth at either end. The underside between the snout and its neck is white. Its green body has three segments with a pair of stubby, spherical orange legs on each segment.

Sewaddle makes itself leafy clothes using chewed-up leaves and a thread-like substance it produces from its mouth, though {{p|Leavanny}} tends to make its first set after hatching. By folding it over its face, its leafy hood is used to help hide it from enemies, whether awake or asleep. [[BW018|It has been shown]] to eat berries, but when food is scarce it will eat its leafy clothing as an alternative.

==In the anime==
[[File:Ash Sewaddle.png|thumb|250px|left|Sewaddle in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Ash's Sewaddle]]====
Ash's Sewaddle debuted in ''[[BW018|Sewaddle and Burgh in Pinwheel Forest!]]'', where {{Ash}} caught it. It evolved into a {{p|Swadloon}} in ''[[BW023|Battling For The Love of Bug-Types!]]'' while battling [[Burgh]]'s {{p|Whirlipede}}, and later into a {{p|Leavanny}} in ''[[BW074|Battling the Leaf Thieves!]]''.

====Other====
A Sewaddle appeared in ''[[BW119|Meowth, Colress and Team Rivalry!]]''.

===Minor appearances===
Multiple Trainers' Sewaddle appeared in ''[[BW019|A Connoisseur's Revenge!]]'', where they were seen at a [[Poké Mart]].

In ''[[BW023|Battling For The Love of Bug-Types!]]'', a {{DL|Burgh|Sewaddle}} was shown to reside at the [[Castelia Gym]].

Multiple Sewaddle appeared in ''[[BW053|A Maractus Musical!]]'' and Sewaddle made brief appearances in ''[[BW066|Baffling the Bouffalant!]]'', ''[[BW067|Cilan Takes Flight!]]'', ''[[BW069|Climbing the Tower of Success!]]'', and ''[[BW074|Battling the Leaf Thieves!]]''.

A Sewaddle appeared in ''[[BW080|Clash of the Connoisseurs!]]'' as one of the Pokémon [[Burgundy]], disguised as Fauxgundy, reviewed as a possible Pokémon for [[Marigold]].

Multiple Sewaddle appeared in ''[[M15|Kyurem VS. The Sword of Justice]]'', during the {{OBP|Swords of Justice|M15}} legend.

A Sewaddle appeared in ''[[BW132|Searching for a Wish!]].''

A Sewaddle appeared in a flashback in ''[[BW140|Survival of the Striaton Gym!]]''.

A group of Sewaddle appeared in ''[[M16|Genesect and the Legend Awakened]]'' at [[Pokémon Hills]].

==Trivia==
* Sewaddle was first seen after it was revealed on Yahoo's official Pokémon site. It was later released in the September issue of CoroCoro.

===Origin===
Sewaddle appears to be based on the {{wp|caterpillar}} of the {{wp|Epargyreus clarus|silver-spotted skipper}}, which produce silk and fold leaves over themselves for shelter. It also shares some characteristics with the larva of {{wp|Weaver ant|weaver ants}}, which produce silk used to form nests.

====Name origin====
Sewaddle may be a combination of ''{{wp|sewing|sew}}'' and ''waddle'' (referring to how a baby walks) or ''swaddle'' (to wrap a baby in cloth).

Kurumiru may be derived from 包む ''kurumu'' (to wrap up) or 胡桃 ''kurumi'' ({{wp|Juglans|walnut tree}}).
